snippet: A sharp rise in the number of female missionaries points to a fundamental shift for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.
abstract: Sharp rise in Mormon women who have signed up as female missionaries after the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints lowered its age requirement is expected to fundamentally alter the church; Mormon leaders have been forced to reassess their views because Mormon women are increasingly supporting households, marrying later and less frequently, and having fewer children.

byline.original: By JODI KANTOR and LAURIE GOODSTEIN
byline.contributor: Jodi Kantor reported from Daejeon, South Korea, and Laurie Goodstein from Salt Lake City.

lead_paragraph: A sharp rise in the number of female missionaries points to a fundamental shift for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

headline.main: Missions Signal a Growing Role for Mormon Women
headline.print_headline: A Growing Role for Mormon Women

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
keywords.name: subject
